sub_title: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration
summary:
I am an ambitious person who aims high and is always open to learn and grow. Studying at the best Hogeschool in the Netherlands has allowed me to build up many business skills in the fields of Marketing and Sales, Finance, Operations and Supply chain, Human resources, Entrepreneurship, Sustainability, and Internationalization. Most importantly, however, I have also developed essential soft skills needed for a future professional, including teamwork, intercultural communication, and self-awareness. 

Additionally, I have experienced how businesses operate in real life through my internships in Digital marketing and Supply chain analysis. Due to the latter, I developed a curiosity to for the world of Data Analytics, and have explored it further through additional courses and projects. 

My next adventure starts at the end of August 2023 when I will start working full-time and write my thesis in order to graduate.

projects.title: Project Social Entrepreneurship
projects.description: Created an extensive business plan for a small social enterprise from Mexico to expand to Europe. To ensure the goals of the bsuiness are met, special attention was given to sustainability policy, corporate social responsibility, and contributions to the greater community.

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

projects.title: Project Strategic Business Decisions - Executive Recommendation
projects.description:
This project was connected with building an executive recommendation for the future operations of Oatly. It was seperated in four main departments, namely Marketing, Supply Chain, Human Resources, and Finance. I was part of the latter as I was interested in diving deeper into the topic and learning how to manage a company's financials on a corporate level. 

I was responsible for analysing Oatly's financial statements from the last four years in order to estimate its financial health based on profitability, liquidity, and solvency value drivers, as well as evaluate its share price and compare it to the current market price. It was found that the bsuiness has very poor financial health, which is why a root cause analysis was conducted. Based on the results, a turn around strategy was proposed to avoid bankruptcy. Then, a 10-year P&L was created to show the change in gross and net profit as well as operational expenses. In order to illustrate the value Oatly will create with its new strategy, a discounted cash flow statement was also constructed, with the help of which a new valuation was made. In the end, with the new turn around strategy it was estimated that Oatly's share price will increase from its current valuation of -$12 to $3 over the next 10 years.

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

projects.title: Project Business Plan
projects.description: The purpose of this individual project was to create a comprehensive 5-year expansion plan for an e-bike business from the Netherlands to the German market. After the entry mode was established, four main areas were focused on, including marketing & sales, supply chain, human resources, and finance.

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

projects.title: Project Country Selection
projects.description:
The main purpose of the report was to select the most suitable country for expansion of an e-bike brand based in the Netherlands. In order to achieve this, a scope was created in order to decrease the number of locations considered. Then, after a SWOT analysis of the company, 4 countires were chosen that were believed to be a good fit for the company's needs and goals. The countries were then graded based on  specific criteria and risk variables. Each factor had a different positive or negative score depending on how important it was for achieving the business objectives. In the end, it was found that out of the pool of 4 countries, including Denmark, Germany, Poland and Spain, the German market is the most attractive for the e-bike brand to expand to.

This was a group assignment made with 3 classmates.

projects.title: Project Business Vision
projects.description:
Implementation plan: the marketing tactics and the financials recommended for the launch as written down (as a result of the deep analysis). Relevant conclusions and recommendations are drawn for the company. 

Continuation of Project Business Vision. Completed with the same group of 5 people total.

projects.title: Project Business Strategy
projects.description:
In this project, a company is planning to expand abroad. The aim is to investigate whether the given country would be suitable for the company subsidiary. Results of the deep market analysis are written down; marketing and financial objectives are set and the marketing strategy for entering the new market is defined.

This group project was conducted with 5 people in total. 

The second part of this project is completed in the next university quarter (Project Business Vision).

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

projects.title: Project Business Research
projects.description:
The assignment was based on a research question that was addressed: "How to improve customer satisfaction with Lidl?”. In order to gain insights into this topic, a questionnaire was created and sent out to 180 Lidl customers. The outcomes of the included questions were turned into statistical data, which was used to test out hypothesis, that had been formed through desk research. 

Finally, the reults of the calculations were used to explain whether the hypothesis were rejected or not, as well as come up with recommendations for the improvement of Lidl's customer satisfaction. This group project was conducted by 8 people.

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

projects.title: Project Business Plan: Master Budget Planning and Positive/Negative Scenario Analysis
projects.description:
This assignment was divided into 2 parts. For the first one a Master budget for 2021 had to be prepared (including all budgets & Schedules and Operating and Financial data) for the “Sweet Tooth” shop in Amsterdam. Moreover, in order for the company to have a broader scope of the possible outcomes for the coming year, a positive and negative scenario analysis neened to be conducted.

To complete the second assignment, it was necessary to create an Investment Budget, calculation of the annual Breakeven sales, budgeted Income statement for 2020 and 2021 and budgeted cash flow statement for 2020 and 2021 from scratch for a new pastry shop, planning to operate in the UK. 

Both parts of the project also required reports with argumentation of the decisions made and conclusions and recommendations for the company. 

This group project was completed by a party of 6 people.

projects.title: SWOT Analysis Project
projects.description: This group assignment was completed by a 6-person party and consisted of making an internal analysis and external analysis of the strenghts, weaknesses, opportunities and threats of Life SUPPLIES - Life Improvement & Food Enhancement, and the industry it is in. The information was gathered though interviews with company managers and desk research.

contributors.headline: Operational Supplier Management Intern at Vanderlande | BSc International Business Administration

profile_positions.description:
As part of my Minor at HU University, I had the opportunity to work with DSV as a consultant in order to help them with a business issue they were facing. My task was to look into their colllected data set so that I can analyse the supply chain operations of one of their customers. The aim was to try to find cost savings in a way that was not yet implemented by my client. 

This project allowed me to deepen my skills in Supply Chain and Finance, as well as Data Analytics. Moreover, the data points were located and researched in an Excel spreadsheet. This means that I also learned how to create and manipulate Excel Pivot tables in order to dissect the information and find spikes or trends. 

After investigating, me and my team came up with solutions to reduce costs. Keeping in mind the differing needs of DSV and the client, I came up with strategies that create the right balance of saving expenses while still being beneficial to the client. I did this by providing different scenarios (optimistic, realistic and pessimistic) with estimated financial savings. In the end, I was able to find 500,000 euros of savings annually, as well as provide advice on how to reduce redundant shipments and increase the accuracy of the collected data.
profile_positions.title: Junior Supply Chain Analyst

profile_positions.description:
The tasks I completed during my work experience (mostly connected to SEO) include:
- Conducting keyword research in order to understand which phrases have high search volume and low difficulty, as well as to set priorities of which words the company wants to rank for. 
- Conducting keyword gap analysis to find out competitor keywords used that my company can also take advantage of. 
- Using Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Keyword Planner and SEMrush which allowed me to hone my skills utilising these programs. 
- Rewriting of meta tags and meta descriptions. 
- Researching ways to increase mobile page speed. 
- Rewriting H1 and H2 tags on the website. 
- Writing newsletter update emails. 
- Changing the copy of one page of the website (Aruba) in order to put more keywords. 
- Creating a report (presentation) explaining customer behaviours based on website heatmaps. 
- Searching for appropriate affiliation programs that the company can work with. 

* Project 1: SWOT Analysis - an extensive description of the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats of canitravel.net are provided, after which a confrontation matrix is created and finally possible strategies the company can use are outlined.

* Project 2: Backlink Strategy - two reports were created (one for the home page and one for Aruba) describing several experiments to be conducted in order to try to get more backlinks. For each method, an excel sheet was created that helps with tracking information and progress.
